meanings.definition: To surpass in raving or madness.
meanings.sent1: She outraves her friends with her wild stories.
meanings.sent2: The crowd outraves the singer at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat outraves the dog in chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: His excitement outraves all others in the room.
meanings.sent5: The storm outraves any we've seen before.

meanings.definition: To rave or act madly beyond the usual bounds.
meanings.sent1: He outraves his classmates with his energetic dance moves.
meanings.sent2: The fans outraves their favorite team's victory.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outraves the other animals in the park with its acrobatics.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outraves the noise of the party.
meanings.sent5: The firework display outraves the night sky.
